alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 4:34PM MST until August 26 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 430 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. The Little Colorado River gauge at Lymun Lake rose three feet. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lyman Lake State Park and Lyman Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 393 and 401. Highway 180 191 between mile markers 373 and 392. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coyote Creek, Nutrioso Creek, Carnero Creek, Lower Lyman Ditch, Vigil Run, Big Hollow Wash and Little Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
